title: AI in Government Act of 2020
summary: Codified the 'AI Center of Excellence' within the GSA to facilitate the adoption of AI technologies across the federal government.

title: Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights
summary: White House OSTP released five principles to guide the design and use of automated systems to protect the American public, emphasizing civil rights and data privacy.

title: Executive Order 14110 on Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy AI
summary: Comprehensive Presidential order invoking the Defense Production Act to require safety testing for powerful models and directing agencies to issue AI guidance.

title: Rescission of Biden AI Executive Order (EO 14148)
summary: President Trump signed an Executive Order rescinding EO 14110 to remove regulatory barriers perceived as hindering AI innovation.

title: Executive Order 14179: Removing Barriers to American Leadership in AI
summary: Established a new policy to sustain U.S. AI dominance, directing agencies to suspend or rescind actions inconsistent with promoting AI innovation and reducing regulatory burdens.

title: Executive Order 14277: Advancing AI Education for American Youth
summary: Established a White House Task Force on AI Education to promote AI literacy, integrate AI into K-12 education, and launch a Presidential AI Challenge.

title: Executive Order 14319: Preventing Woke AI in the Federal Government
summary: Mandates that federal agencies only procure AI models that adhere to principles of 'truth-seeking' and 'ideological neutrality,' explicitly prohibiting models trained with DEI-based bias.

title: America's AI Action Plan
summary: Unveiled a comprehensive strategy focused on three pillars: Accelerating AI Innovation, Building American AI Infrastructure (data centers/energy), and Leading in International AI Security.

title: Draft EO: Eliminating State Law Obstruction of National AI Policy
summary: A draft executive order circulated by the White House proposing to establish an 'AI Litigation Task Force' to challenge state AI laws and to withhold federal broadband funding from states with 'onerous' AI regulations.
